Foreign Minister Meets New Nigerian Ambassador 
    Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun met and conversed with newly-appointed Nigerian Ambassador e. p. here Sule Buba who paid a courtesy call on him on June 15.

articles.content:
Law against DPRK Adopted in Japan
    Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- The Japanese right-wing conservative forces committed such a crime as adopting a law calling for tight sanctions against the DPRK, according to a press report. The "law banning the portcall of specified foreign ships" was finally adopted at the meeting of the House of Councilors of Japan on June 14.
 This formally put the law into force.    
 This once again clearly indicates that the Japanese right-wing conservative forces have never given up their foolish ambition to isolate and stifle the DPRK.

articles.title: Russian Dance Company Arrives
articles.content:
Russian Dance Company Arrives
    Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- The State Academic Moiseyev Folk Dance Company of Russia led by Elena Scherbakova, director of the company, arrived here on June 16.
 It was greeted at the airport by Pak Kyong Son, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned, Russian Ambassador Andrei Karlov and staff members of the Russian embassy here.

articles.title: Meeting of Our Nation Opens
Credentials Presented to Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Credentials Presented to Kim Yong Nam
    Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Willy C. Gaa, new Philippine ambassador e. p. to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on June 16.
 Present there were Vice-minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Yong Il and staff members of the Philippine embassy.    
 After receiving credentials the president conversed with the ambassador.
